website_summaries.verdict: The JVC HA-RX900 is an excellent over-ear model that will impress listeners shopping for a low-cost headphone to use at work or in the office.
pros: The JVC HA-RX900 is an affordable headphone with a comfortable fit and smooth performance on rock, jazz and classical music
cons: The bulky design and superlong cord aren't suited for travel, and the lack of low-end boost will likely disappoint fans of bass heavy genres

customer_reviews.title: Comfy with good sound
customer_reviews.text: I'm by no means a audiophile but these are the best sounding headphones I own. I got them mainly for the soft padding and the over the ear design. I can't stand headphones that crush my ears. These are not indestructible, unfortunately I've been through two pairs of these already and may need to order a 3rd one. The plastic that connects the headset part to the speakers is either very flimsy or my head is too big and has broken on me twice (after a good year or two of daily use). Right now mine is being held together with crazy glue but I've already had to reapply.
customer_reviews.author: JDT

customer_reviews.title: Simply Incredible headphones on all fronts
customer_reviews.text: The music coming out of these is beyond description as to fidelity and cleanliness. I used them with my keyboard's headphone jack and the sound was concert hall compared to my Sony headphones. You can isolate noise around you as the cups cover your entire ear. They are not a small unit. They appear solid in the frame and you simply will not want to take them off. Cord is convertible to plug into your computer. My studio setup is finally complete with these. I hear thing I do not hear on my monitors. I went up to the 900 based on several trusted reviewers comments that the upgrade was significant in sound. They were right!
customer_reviews.author: Captain PaulTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Extremely pleased with the JVC HA-RX900.
customer_reviews.text: I tried out several headphones before settling with these. They have the perfect amount of clear bass (not too low, not too high) along with well balanced midrange and high notes. Did not need an equalizer. Could not find a better pair in this price range. A wonderful listening experience while plugged into my Echo Dot and mp3 player. I prefer Beats EP over more expensive Beats, but they cost almost three times these JVC. My old Sony MDR-V600 did not have enough bass, and the new Sony have too much. I definitely prefer this model over their HA-RX700. Wish they came with a coiled cord. Oh, well.
customer_reviews.author: Mic Wingo

customer_reviews.title: Comically large headphones that work well
customer_reviews.text: These are bigger than I expected. But they do fit well on my small noggin within the narrowest adjustment points. The sound quality is as good as I've ever heard being a cheap headphone enthusiast, they provide moderate isolation. There was a very rare buzzing plastic sound but it seems to have gone away. The ear cup padding and material is certainly budget and does not breath. After about 60 hours of use they are still holding up and comfortable enough for extended use. Given the choice again I would try a different set, maybe the Sony MDRV6 (~$80), but for now the JVC's are good.
customer_reviews.author: Wright Roe

customer_reviews.title: Good all around headphone - average sound reproduction
customer_reviews.text: I guess I expected more from reading the reviews but I should have known better from the price. Don't get me wrong - I kept the headphones and I do use them but not for what I originally intended. I get better sound reproduction from my urBeats Pros: Like the extra long cord The over the ear style fits comfortably Although plastic, the set feels quite sturdy Cons: A bit heavy (but I knew that at purchase) Sound quality - a "hollow" sound, too much mid-range. Poor bass even on bass heavy songs. Highs are okay, a bit "tinny"
customer_reviews.author: Soccer99Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: These are the best sounding headphones you're going to get for under $100
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, all the stuff you've heard is true. These are the best sounding headphones you're going to get for under $100. There are some major drawbacks, like the lack of a removable cord. But i've replaced the jack on my pair twice in 4 years (I used to be pretty hard on them, but now these headphones are my babies), and even still these are incredible phones. There is a burn in time, I recommend just skipping the whole blaring hip-hop in them and just letting the burn in happen naturally. There will come a point when you notice that these phones are provide you about as beautiful sound as you could expect for the price.
customer_reviews.author: K.S.

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations :)
customer_reviews.text: Love these no complaints . Enjoy these better than a popular coiled Sony studio MDR headphones ( available for decades) owned for a few years . JVC hp are Comfortable ( soft big padding) and music sounds great ( jazz, rock, pop, funk, classical ) . I lay back on my pillow , put these on and enjoy the music after a long day at work . Or, during the weekend while lounging around and shutting out the cares of the world.
customer_reviews.author: NK

customer_reviews.title: Only left speaker worked  OOTB. Returned and reordered.  Fingers crossed!
customer_reviews.text: How do I give 2.5 stars- because it only half worked. Right speaker was dead out of the box. Returning it to Amazon. Left speaker sounded pretty awesome out of the box.:-) If both speakers worked I might have given it 5 stars. I have a large head and for the few minutes that I wore it, it felt very comfortable. Box seems like it was sealed so I see no reason to ding the seller. Product arrived ahead of time. Ordered another one from a different seller. Hopefully this one will not be defective. Fingers crossed! will update review after I try the replacement.
customer_reviews.author: AC BC DC

customer_reviews.title: Earpads do get warm
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Good build quality, should last for a long time - Overall OK sound quality - lack a little details and treble to my ears but good enough for its price range Cons: - Earpads do get warm after using it for a while - Long and non-detachable cable is not convenient but OK fr it's price range
customer_reviews.author: Y. Chen

customer_reviews.title: Solid bass
customer_reviews.text: These have decent bass response. If they did not work as well then bass response would improve when I press them to my ears. I do notice that the audio sounds more distant unless I press them to my ears.
customer_reviews.author: James Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, Poorly Built
customer_reviews.text: I bought these headphones 2 months ago. For the past 2 weeks, sound quality has been spotty - audio would only come in through one ear unless you twisted it to the right angle. Today, the headphone jack split into 3 pieces, one of which is lodged in my audio port, disallowing access from other earbuds or headphones, except for ones requiring a USB port. Up until then, Sound quality was clear, and the headphones were incredibly comfortable. Also, the cord was incredibly long, which was a bonus. It is also worth mentioning that while these headphones are over-ear, they let out so much sound that they may as well be used as speakers.
customer_reviews.author: MLee

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, insulates from outside noise, but a bit heavy
customer_reviews.text: A bit on the heavier side and starts to hurt if I wear glasses with it for too long. Also hurts my skull if I wear them for too long event without glasses. Can't do more than 4 or 5 consecutive hours with these. Essentially functions as noise cancelling though because of the density and the over the ear foam that insulates your ears. Has a great low end response but need to use an EQ frequently to bring it the level I want it. You definitely need to break them in though, at first there was almost no bass response when I took them out of the packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Scarlet

customer_reviews.title: These are great
customer_reviews.text: A bunch of web sites have instructions about modifying them to make the bass better. I see no need for that. I'm not an audiophile I guess. I don't "get" all the adjectives and metaphors folks use to describe the sounds of headphones. I just know they sound great, better than any I've used. But I don't make a habit of trying many different headphones either. Still, they seem as good as many reviews suggest they are. I'm very, very happy with them. I'm not concerned about portability. I use some good earphones when portability is important. I use these when I want to really listen and enjoy the music our movie audio.
customer_reviews.author: CFL 246

customer_reviews.title: Could not be happier!!!
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are great! Crystal clear sound, not too heavy. I use them at work so i am wearing them for hours on end and they remain comfortable the whole time. They are big enough to cover my Dumbo-like ears, they don't clamp down on my head like other headphones i have had, but they still remain in place when i swing my head around. LOOOOOONG cord, i think its 10ft. you can use these with your phone/ipod/whatev and there are no volume issues. I am completely in love with these and would HIGHLY recommend them to anyone looking for a decent pair!!
customer_reviews.author: Xolin_

customer_reviews.title: My son loves them.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my son. He loved them. He used them for quite awhile, until the cat got her little paws on them. October 2016 to a couple of weeks ago, and he used them for long periods every day, so we definitely got our moneys worth.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Durable high-quality headphone
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a head phone that does not have the annoying flaking problem that plague many high end headphones. And this is it!!! Its ear covers are made with a different material that ensures they are soft on the ears but will not flake after 1-2 years.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Liem

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What Was Needed
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my dad on Father's Day. He said he needed a pair of headphones that could get his computer volume louder, because the one's he had were at FULL BLAST and not loud enough. AND THEY WEREN'T! So after some looking around I came across these headphones. THEY ARE AWESOME. They are big, though, so you probably don't want to go to the gym, because you will bump into everything there. Maybe even knock someone over. BUT the point remains the same...THEY INCREASED THAT VOLUME ON THE COMPUTER, and I heard them, they BLAST LOUD. GREAT PRODUCT oldie but goodie JVC!
customer_reviews.author: Deal And ZaH

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Being a fan of their earbuds i thought id try something bigger to replace my damaged studio headphones. Now they arnt my old pioneer Hdj1000 but heres what i think. Pros: Fits my big head and doesn't pinch. Sound quality is as expected for price range super long cord Cons: you get what pay for about quality parts, its plastic don't expect it last long. bass has much to be desired, sounds like the ear buds but bigger in size. headphone jack is huge, so big infect i will have to take my ipod out of its case to use it So far so good and im liking it for what it is and am happy with them so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Mos

customer_reviews.title: Over-A-Cheever for this pay grade
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was taking a risk on purchasing these head phones. NOT! They have very good sound, above average comfort,and priced right!They actually feel good on your head! I enjoy listening to all different genres of music with the X900s. Plus they EQ real well on all freq..They remind me a little like my Sennheisers(much higher priced) head phones. The engineers at JVC were on it when they came up with the X900s. Good value! Very good for general music listening! And for the runners and joggers don`t ask if you can work out in these! Good Gracious!
customer_reviews.author: KP Jandt

customer_reviews.title: Love these headphones!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: *Comfortable. Great for extended wear like listening to music all day at a programming or other stare-at-the-screen-all-day job. *Awesome sound! *Great price! Pro/Con Depends on the individual: *Open-Air design (muffs still cover the ear) means it is poor with noise isolation (might be good for stealth eavesdropping though), but it helps the bass. Con: *Impedance (ohms) is high. Much Better when hooked up to a home stereo or computer (laptops ok) than a mobile/portable music player, which doesn't output enough power for a high volume (for those that want their music loud).
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Roberge

customer_reviews.title: Love them.
customer_reviews.text: GREAT Sound!!! Bass isn't heavy unless you have an EQ to open them up. I prefer Banging Bass, and all around Clarity. These do have more relaxed listening pleasure. Sophisticated you could say, compared to more expensive models, I'm not saying better, but great for the price point. Not very portable due to the 10 foot cord, but great for late night, laying in bed listening.
customer_reviews.author: Robert I.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, but clunky to wear
customer_reviews.text: Good headphones, but the cups are essentially flat. It's like wearing 2 plates on the sides of your head.
customer_reviews.author: Lilia

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones!  Very pleased.
customer_reviews.text: Great sound throughout the range. Bass reproduction is accurate and not overwhelming. Headband fit is very comfortable for me and after wearing the cans for a bit, the tension let up and now they're awesome. No noise from the cord once you get about a foot away from the headphones. Really long cord, so keep a twist tie or some velcro handy. The only bad thing I can say about these headphones is that now my wife wants a pair, so now I have to buy them again. Could be worse, though, since the price is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Avery Abbott

customer_reviews.title: High-quality Headset
customer_reviews.text: I am a gamer and love to experience the bass of explosions as well as the music in games like Skyrim. Also, directional sounds (footsteps) can be important. These headphones do all of that in addition to playing my collection of heavy metal tracks with high-quality. My wife and I share an office, so these have also cut down on complaints from the wife about the screaming and explosions that sound regularly form my games, lol. These headphones are not noise cancelling, though, and they do not claim to be. If they did, they would be absolutely perfect. I would highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: CJBSmith

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic depth of sound
customer_reviews.text: The headphones have the best sound quality of any I've owned. Granted that I am not an extremely experienced person with these sorts of purchases and have never owned anything like audiophiles, but for my purposes, these headphones are excellent. I ended up attaching a microphone to the side with velcro like is suggested in the pictures and use these as my computer headphones for both gaming, music, and movies. The depth of the sound is great and can be manipulated by your audio processing software to provide realistic reproductions of different sound set ups (5.1 audio reproductions, for example). The bass is strong, but not overpowering. I love these headphones. Muse has never sounded better.
customer_reviews.author: Silvr

customer_reviews.title: Big Awesome-Sounding Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I'll admit I'm not an audiophile, and I don't really have any other full size headphones to compare these to, but I am very satisfied with my purchase. They are large and the build quality seems to be good. All I can say regarding the sound is that it sounded pretty 'accurate' out of the box, but to get decent bass for the type of music I listen to I adjusted the equalizer on the software side. They are comfortable, I've used them for about three hours in one sitting, no discomfort. They don't feel heavy on your head. Overall, especially considering price, I highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: A. Bagley

customer_reviews.title: $60 headphones shouldn't sound this good!
customer_reviews.text: Great phones for the money. Nice even frequency response, not overly bass heavy or overly bright. The cushions are comfortable but do get a bit warm after a while. They sound very good in a studio situation, with quality equipment that drive headphones well. The isolation is decent too, much much better than "open air" style phones. I suspect their output might be a bit low if connected to a portable device, like an iPhone, iPad, or Android equivalent. I previously had a pair of JVC H990s (late 1990s) that served me very well for 15 years. The HARX900 is a fine successor.
customer_reviews.author: Conan

customer_reviews.title: Started out nice, connections started going out.
customer_reviews.text: I have had these headphones for a few months now. When I had first received them, there was a lot of pressure due to it being closed back. I have either gotten used to it or it has lessened over time which was nice. A few days ago the connection to the left speaker on it has become loose and I need to wiggle the cord around for it to actually play sound. I also need to be careful when moving my head so that the connection actually stays. So while I've had them, I enjoyed the quality. They have since started to go out on me. I was hoping they would last at least a year.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Stark

customer_reviews.title: - Sound quality is great. Compared to the average gaming headset I bought ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm not an audiophile. Pros: - Sound quality is great. Compared to the average gaming headset I bought these were noticeably better. - I find these very comfortable to wear for hours on end - Plenty of cord length Cons: - For a closed panel, sound escapes pretty easy and background noise comes through.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Beaty

customer_reviews.title: wonderful
customer_reviews.text: I have owned JVC headphones before and while they arent the best of the best, I don't have the money to afford that as they are usually pretty up there in price. These headphones were very affordable, comfortable, with a super long cable which is nice. The sound quality is very good, quick and accurate, though the bass is sometimes a bit lacking. That is usually not an issue for me as I do not listen to dubstep or the like very often, sticking more to classical where bass heavy enough to overload the headphones just doesn't really happen.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Locke

customer_reviews.title: while big and heavy the sounds is good
customer_reviews.text: as you read up on head phones you'll find that there are better headphones than this; but will ears know? i agree with some write ups I read, the sounds got better with the headphones the more the headsphones are used. Just note these things are big and heavy. if you are looking for solid sound, yes - long term use might be a bit much. but the soundscape immersion is actually very nice. And the big canisters do end up subduing external sounds, making it rather easy for folks to sneak up on you even at lower volume
customer_reviews.author: djcabz

customer_reviews.title: Great Competitive FPS gaming headphones
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had these for 8 years now and they are still in perfect condition. I got these for the wide soundstage specifically for gaming. They are the best headphones I’ve had so far for gaming. Specifically competitive FPS gaming, the wide soundstage makes it really easy to hear footsteps. I’m beyond impressed with the build quality. After 8 years of rough usage they have held up very well.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: Big, really Big
customer_reviews.text: Big Headphones, Big sound but it needs it's own amp. This is actually the second one I've owned, noisy neighbors requires a product like this.Would I buy it again? I already did.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: JVC HARX900 headphones
customer_reviews.text: i've used these for several months now and i like them very much. they sound better than any of my other headphones for music. i bought them on sale after reading about them winning an audio magazine shoot-out of under $100 headphones. they have a very long cord, but i bought an extension cord to give me some extra slack so i can move between my theatre recliner and my computer desk without removing them.
customer_reviews.author: kp

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good all around.
customer_reviews.text: Very well made. Audio quality is above average, but not amazing. Noise cancellation/dampening is pretty decent, but again, not amazing. Very fair for the price and overall I don't think anyone would be disappointed with these headphones for general use. Side note, bass is exceptional, oddly enough.
customer_reviews.author: Pirate_Joke

customer_reviews.title: First non-gaming headset
customer_reviews.text: I've had many gaming headsets in the past, ranging from Turtle Beach X11-12s, Triton AX-720s and Astro A-40s, so that's all I have to compare this headset to. Pros: Sound quality for music/movies is much better than all my previous gaming headsets Price is amazing. Build quality is higher than expected, but not incredible. Comfy even after 5-8 hours use. Cons: Sound/direction awareness is noticeably lower, but still exists. Kind of large.. Conclusion: 9.5/10 would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Sorrells

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good budget choice
customer_reviews.text: Falls can easily knock the internals out of place but they easily snap back in. These are the most comfortable I have tried, and the quality is around that of the Skullcandy Hesh 2 for 40 bucks, but with more bass and slightly less clarity
customer_reviews.author: Cory Hatcher

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: I use these headphones to listen to audio for my profession. These headphones work very well, and I rarely have to rely on sound enhancing software to make out what I'm listening to.
customer_reviews.author: l

customer_reviews.title: ... month and I must admit that I am very satisfied. For the price you will not be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have owned the JVC HARX900 full sized headphones for roughly a month and I must admit that I am very satisfied. For the price you will not be disappointed. The bass is deep and balanced and the highs are crisp and clear; the sound is remarkable. The headphones are somewhat heavy but not necessarily uncomfortable. The headphones are definitely on par with headsets that are nearly four times more expensive. The look of the headphones gives it a high-tech DJ look to it which will look nice on your head or while at rest on a counter.
customer_reviews.author: Yusuff Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Not one of their better headphones.
customer_reviews.text: I knew that when I bought them based on the price. JVC has high quality products. These are just on the lower end of the scale.
customer_reviews.author: Rated It

customer_reviews.title: and they are fantastic at blocking out the noise around me so that ...
customer_reviews.text: I use these at work, and they are fantastic at blocking out the noise around me so that I can concentrate on the work I need to get done. The sound quality is also very good, even when working with my VERY old iPod classic. I would definitely recommend these headphones to others.
customer_reviews.author: Michael & Allison Affourtit

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic sound, excellent padding
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic sound, excellent padding. Really good head support. You can wear these all day if the situation arises and you won't feel a thing. The substantial padding really blocks exterior noise reasonably as well, so I would suggest these if you need something to help you focus and block outside sound. Great studying mufflers. Just be careful if you have long hair, it can get snagged a little when taking them off.
customer_reviews.author: COLIN M HUNTER

customer_reviews.title: JVC HARX900 Sound Good
customer_reviews.text: I know it when I hear it and I'm hard of hearing. Fit nicely over my hearing aids. Brings tears to your eyes if you love music. Beethoven Ludwig van - Symphonies - Gardiner & Orchestre Revolutionnaire et Romantique John Eliot Gardiner sounds so good right out of the box on my laptop. Very comfy. Slow delivery from the midwest - I should give it one star for the lousy shipping. Research your headphones. This is a sweet one.
customer_reviews.author: Anarchy

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Working beautifully and certainly an upgrade from my old HARX300 set. Feels great with wide and deep cups, useful for my large ears. The long cable is also fairly thick and long, so I'm expecting it to last. If these are better than the old set, I can expect them to hold out fine. (The old set still functions, I just felt it was time for a new set)
customer_reviews.author: Leroy

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: down side to them is they are not comfortable but other then that the head set is fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: danielle

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: The last full headphones I had were a bit heavy and the ear covers were cloth which attracts a lot of dust after a while, these JVC headphones are lightweight, comfortable, and easily fit over my large ears. The sound is very good, I noticed a bit of noise on the line but that could be my sound levels not being adjusted correctly since I got a new mixer at the same time that I got these, but so far they are a great but for the price and have a cable with length to spare
customer_reviews.author: Jorden

customer_reviews.title: They really are big...
customer_reviews.text: But in-spite of the size, they work great. I have no regrets. The only thing is that they are not quite as noise cancelling as I would like. I have noisy office mates and when they get going, I don't think anything could keep the noise out. Good fit. Comfortable. All in all a great headphone.
customer_reviews.author: M. Megan Casey

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for the Price: Don't waste money on the supposed high-end Headphones
customer_reviews.text: They fit well. (don't need to adjust 1000 times). They're comfortable. (your won't want to rip your ears off after 30 min.) They provide every sound you want. (unless you make a $7+ figure yearly salary and require top end you couldn't afford anyway) Basically what I am saying, don't drop $150.00+ on a pair of headphones that really do not provide much more quality(if any sometimes) than the ones that have the same Neodymium driver and similar ear cup housing.
customer_reviews.author: mg75

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Best headphones in it's price range, and probably more. I've tried quite a few other headphones. I originally bought these 3 years ago, and bought a new one this year when I started working. Ended up returning the others and just relapsing back to buying a second set of these. Wonderful quality, comfort, and very soundproof from others.
customer_reviews.author: MingYang L.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I order these to use while I listen to my audio books. Great sound quality noise canceling technology for the price. These JVC HARX900 have a long cord to move around with. I would recommend if you are planning to DJ a part or work in the studio.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly D. Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great set of phones for the price, betters similarly priced Sennheisers. Plenty of videos on easy mods that take them up several levels. Delicate pads that are easy to rip when removing. I have several hi end headphones and these still sound pleasant, not Hifiman or Beyerdynamic, but they don't cost $500 either.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Bair

customer_reviews.title: Frequency range
customer_reviews.text: This set of headphones is great! The depth of sound is SO good! As a tin-ear guy, I'm used to not getting the sounds, but the extra range seems to expand the sound - music, special effects, movies, games... 10/10 would buy again. 9/10 would give as a gift...
customer_reviews.author: J Swann

customer_reviews.title: These are the best
customer_reviews.text: Wow, are these things comfy. I got these because they go over the ear. All my others hurt after 5 minutes of wearing them. The sound and builed are very good quality. I couldn't be more pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Lad

customer_reviews.title: RX700 vs RX900
customer_reviews.text: I've had the RX700's and used them for 4 years and abused them the whole time. Very durable headphones they didn't even scratch, the cable didn't split or cut, So when they finally did break I thought I'd try the 900's. Does it sound better? Slightly. Are they more comfortable? Definitely, without a doubt more comfortable. Are they twice the price better? Maybe.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Stennett

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, big enough to wear
customer_reviews.text: Good sound, big enough to wear, but because I'm sensitive to fatiguing headphones, the original pads caused some discomfort from getting too warm. If you "run hot", these will get warm and you will have to take a break from wearing them after an hour. I replaced the earcups with velour pads (a huge pain to actually find and fit a pair) but they are still a bit fatiguing. Also a bit too chunky to wear around your neck. Love the long cord. Sound and build quality are excellent.
customer_reviews.author: d

customer_reviews.title: SUPERB SOUND, a little heavy
customer_reviews.text: I did a ton of research before deciding on these headphones, and I think it paid off. The sound is awesome and they are very comfortable. I think they may be just a little bit heavy for a full day's use (as I often use them), but I think that's just to be expected with a set this big. The cord is nice and long, the cups fit all the way over my ears...and again, GREAT sound.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D. Britton

customer_reviews.title: I think these headphones are pretty nice. They're big
customer_reviews.text: As a non-audiophile, I think these headphones are pretty nice. They're big, but not too heavy, and have ample padding. The sound seems pretty great to me, but again, I'm no expert. I read in other reviews that they were causing discomfort for people with glasses. They do seem to cause some discomfort after wearing them for an hour or two, but I'm not sure that that's because I'm wearing glasses, and I would bet that the same could be said for any headphones of this size.
customer_reviews.author: What

customer_reviews.title: Good Headphones.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! This is my second pair. My first pair lasted 4-5 years. (accidentally stepped on my last ones). Excellent for music and gaming. Excellent bass quality vs other brands. Thank you JVC!
customer_reviews.author: SigmaX

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones for the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought these on sale for about half of list price. They have served me really well, they are comfortable, they are closed which is great, as I use them when the people I live with are asleep. I have yet to hear a pair of fifty dollar headphones that sound better. They have a long cord and can fit 3.5mm or 1/4" with included adapter. A better pair of headphones at this price point can't be found.
customer_reviews.author: Mygaffer

customer_reviews.title: Extremely comfortable, and sound amazing
customer_reviews.text: Extremely comfortable, and sound amazing. The strap for your head sometimes pushes your hair back but that really can't be helped, as well as your ears get hot after a while but a 5 minute break alleviates that. Just be warned, these headphones are really big.
customer_reviews.author: Colby Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good quality headphones for the price
customer_reviews.text: I was not disappointed with overall perfomance and quality. Primarily used for guitar practice through amp headphone input. Very comfortable and great audio response.
customer_reviews.author: Armando I. Ochoa

customer_reviews.title: love them
customer_reviews.text: they are comfortable even when gaming for hours and have very crisp clear sound. I used to use a gaming headset and was very pleased to get such great sound from a relatively inexpensive headphones. Edit : I purchased these headphones in march of 2014 and to this day they work flawlessly. They sound better now then when I bought them and would highly recommend these to anyone looking for a quality pair of headphones that wont break your bank.
customer_reviews.author: haswell

customer_reviews.title: Broke within two years
customer_reviews.text: Bought this new and used for a little less than two years. It broke after a year and a half. I glued it together and broke again a few months later. Could not be fixed again as the wire to the head phone broke. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Tony H

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Had these for several months now; sound quality is very good, construction quality is very good also. The adjustable features allow the headset to fit quite comfortably. UPDATE: After a couple of years the earphones break off where they connect to the upper part. Heavy duct tape worked to keep them in place for a while. Now both sides have broken off again, rendering the headphones completely useless.
customer_reviews.author: QuantumFog

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones and easy to mod. I have made the cord removable, added sound deadener to the inside of the cups, added polyfill to the inside of the cups, and swapped the earpads to a velour pair. They feel and sound as nice, if not better than my friends $350 Sennheiser headphones. Very high quality and comparable to much more expensive headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Wells

customer_reviews.title: The sound quality is good though, especially considering how little they cost
customer_reviews.text: These work well but they are MASSIVE. Thankfully I only intended to use these while sitting in my office. Definitely would not want to walk around with these on my neck/head. The sound quality is good though, especially considering how little they cost.
customer_reviews.author: R. Casper

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend using these as primary headphones for a desktop
customer_reviews.text: I bought these headphones about 5 years ago, and they have been giving me a quality audio experience since day 1. I have not noticed any degradation of the product since buying it, and they work well with any device that you choose to plug them into. I would recommend using these as primary headphones for a desktop, since the wires connecting the headphones to the device are rather long.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful headphones
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are perfect. Not too expensive and they have amazing sound. These phones are large, but not heavy. The leathery pads are very soft and sit comfortably around my ears. The bass is very deep and very good. The other details in music are clear and crisp. I use these at home. I have Sony V600's at work and they are not nearly as comfortable (though not bad) and do not sound quite as good as these JVCs. These take some power -- I have to max out my iPhone 4 volume to get the sound I want. Those who need it louder may need an amplifier.
customer_reviews.author: D. Everly

customer_reviews.title: Sound is good enough but they're monsters and clamp my brains out
customer_reviews.text: Sound is good enough but they're monsters and clamp my brains out. Bought them to replace some Sony MDR V6 whose plug went wonky and because those have a super long curly cord that makes wearing them horrible with an iPod. Wore the JVC once.
customer_reviews.author: T. Noll

customer_reviews.title: Eh....
customer_reviews.text: Way too big for my head and the sound was not that great.
customer_reviews.author: Amabuyingstuff Customer

customer_reviews.title: I am now a believer!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? I use to be one of many users of "gaming" headsets. Not knowing what real gaming sounds were like, I thought my old G35s from Logitech were the best headphones ever. I was skeptical when people recommended these headphones in many different forums. Claiming that these were the poor man's Ath a900, superb for gaming and music. Their claims were proven true when I set up these bad boys with my xonar dg. I kept getting goose bumps from the realism of these headphones in battlefield 3, the sounds were clear and crisp with booming base. And most important of all they are super comfy for my giant head!
customer_reviews.author: Damnyoutaco

customer_reviews.title: Highly satisfying for a personal audio experience
customer_reviews.text: These are the best pair of headphones I've ever had. The sound better than cans which cost considerably more, are more comfortable, and appear more durable. The sound is rich and full; the headphones sit securely over the head and comfortably over the ears. I can't believe these didn't cost me twice as much. I don't regret picking these up at all!
customer_reviews.author: A. Wakefield

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal sound!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic sound! Sometimes I forget that Bose isn't the only high end speaker manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha R.

customer_reviews.title: These headphones are no joke.
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Right from the start, I have been very impressed with these headphones. JVC packed alot into a set of under $60 headphones. I have just about reached the 100 hour mark so the phones are just about broken in and they sound better and better. I dont know how they rate against $200 cans but I see no reason to upgrade down the road. Very impressive bass. Im happy with the mids and highs as well. Good job JVC.
customer_reviews.author: nvelli

customer_reviews.title: Headphones
customer_reviews.text: Nice sounding, fit nice. They are big and do warm your ears after awhile. Wish a carry bag came with the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Galvan

customer_reviews.title: This is like my 4th pair of these
customer_reviews.text: This is like my 4th pair of these. I love them I just wish I would stop dropping them. I think it's time I upgrade to wireless.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Works for me!
customer_reviews.text: I mostly use these to listen to books on tape as I'm working in my home shop. They also serve double duty as ear protection from loud noises (machines, family, the dogs, etc). I might look ridiculous wearing these along with my close-up magnifier headgear and full face shield but so what?
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: have only used for an hour or so but sounds great, really like the feeling of the bass with ...
customer_reviews.text: Received quickly, have only used for an hour or so but sounds great, really like the feeling of the bass with these headphones over the on top of ear sound I get from my Bose headphones.
customer_reviews.author: David Brinkman

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME but cheap power cord.
customer_reviews.text: I got these for gaming, and they sound awesome and are super comfortable. I'm one of those people who get headaches easily from headphones being to tight, but these were super light on the sides of my head. The only reason I took a star off was because the power going into the left side was making a scratching noise every time i moved my head. I have two monitors so it got annoying. I ended up just taping the power to the headphone to make it tighter and the noise went away.
customer_reviews.author: andrew coleman

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality for the money
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable. Have had this for quite a few years now. Sound rivals more expensive units
customer_reviews.author: Consumer123

customer_reviews.title: Not buying them again
customer_reviews.text: The RT headphone broke again. I thought buying the 900 instead of the 700, I would think the headphones are better than the lower product. They were awesome until they broke.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Bauer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent! These headphones paired with my Fiio X1 and ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! These headphones paired with my Fiio X1 and E11 portable amp have transformed my music. I can hear things I've never heard before in songs that I've listened to hundreds of times. I would definitely buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew G.

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: I like these. I had the HA RA700 before, these replaced they.
customer_reviews.author: P. Avenson

customer_reviews.title: great sounding head phone for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I purchase the used ref. for $38 a great bargin for the price. I believe in great sound headphones for the best price. But there are more out there that is cheaper and sounds better. Its a close second. The ear cover seal in the this JVC is two thumbs way up.!!!!! best ear seal for the price.
customer_reviews.author: 2LC

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, rich sounding headphones
customer_reviews.text: I use these at home for playing bass through my macbook pro and saffire 6 usb interface. They are comfortable and sound very rich and defined and are not at all boomy. For the price they cannot be beat. I've used and owned sonys and audiotechnicas in higher price ranges and prefer the sound and feel of these.
customer_reviews.author: garmenteros

customer_reviews.title: great headphones. Make sure you pair them with a ...
customer_reviews.text: Bang for the buck, great headphones. Make sure you pair them with a good DAC amplifier to get the best out of them. You might need to replace the earpads eventually though. Great highs and mids, could use a bit more bass, but tweakable with the amplifier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: sound is nice and ear cover keeps out the noise nicely
customer_reviews.text: Have purchased and used these headphones before, no real complaints, sound is nice and ear cover keeps out the noise nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Mambo

customer_reviews.title: Great bargain
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are a great bargain. They sound fantastic also. They are a 50mm and the earcups are large. Quite the 'audiophile' experience without the price. UPDATE 2/2/16 They broke. Left-side is out unless I jiggle the wire by the 1/8in connector. Lots of similar issues in the one-star reviews. Bummer. I might by another pair just because of the price.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Beaudette

customer_reviews.title: absolutely great, in my humble opinion
customer_reviews.text: If there is anything to complain about ,does not fully cover my ears(blessed with big,big ears)and causes pain after some time. Now on the other side FANTASTIC FULL SPECTRUM SOUND REPRODUCTION, depending on sound source--feed trash in,get trash out but feed clean clear loss- sound and ye shall be rewarded
customer_reviews.author: DAN MO

customer_reviews.title: These are so good. Apple Beats is a sham and a total ...
customer_reviews.text: Lost my first pair. These are so good. Apple Beats is a sham and a total rip off. Bose too. These sound better at less than a quarter of the price.
customer_reviews.author: Diogenes

customer_reviews.title: Best headphones I have every owned
customer_reviews.text: So comfortable and they sound amazing. I wear them at work and drown out my cube mates when i need to be heads down in a project. They are large so do not get these if you need something easy to travel with. These are for people who cannot be without great sound no matter were they are. I looked and tried a lot of headphones and these are by far the best I have used and seen.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Great head phones for the price and they are very Comfortable. I just wish they had more bass. Oh, I think they are way to big to travel with.
customer_reviews.author: NY Girl

customer_reviews.title: Poor Construction
customer_reviews.text: Sounds great, but little pieces of the soft plastic skin at the padding and the top started to peel off a year and a half after regular use. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: rx78nt

customer_reviews.title: Great buy.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these forever ago. I love the extra long cord and the beautiful sound they produce. The headband is quite comfortable for those extended hours of wearing them due to its oversized goodness. I would recommend to buy these.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Guimond

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME HEADPHONES
customer_reviews.text: THESE HEADPHONES ARE SIMPLY AWESOME!!! I WOULD RATE THEM RIGHT THERE WITH THE BEST OF THEM. THE HIGHS AND LOWS THAT COME THRU ARE VERY CLEAR.FOR 60$ YOU CAN'T BET THEM.VERY HAPPY,LOVE THEM!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Holy crap! when i bought these i though they were ...
customer_reviews.text: Holy crap! when i bought these i though they were just going to be an ok set of headphones. Turns out they blew me away with the sound quality, heck i have used headsets twice as expensive as this guy that sound like crap in comparison to this beast.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara N Larson

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones!
customer_reviews.text: Great Headphones! I first bought HARX700 about 4 years ago (still work great, they are repurposed elsewhere) and now I have purchased JVC HARX900 for everyday use. Very happy with the purchase, headphones are really comfortable, great sound, great quality. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Aneta

customer_reviews.title: The sound is pretty good and they are comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Extra long cord is exactly what I wanted. The sound is pretty good and they are comfortable. They are a bit loose on my head but they work fine and don't fall off or anything, after all i'm using them sitting down not running.
customer_reviews.author: wendy

customer_reviews.title: I have a big head and these fit comfortably on my head.
customer_reviews.text: These are massive. I have a big head and these fit comfortably on my head. Most headphones/headsets are a little tight. The sound is great for the price. EDIT: I've been using these for over a year and they are still in great shape. Smaller, cheaper headphones I have bought in the past have usually malfunctioned at this point. I'm pretty careless with them too. They are durable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones for people with big heads
customer_reviews.text: These are great headphones for people with big heads like me. Not binding. Closed cups block sound from others, so they are not disturbed. Quality sound throughout the audio range. Can turn up loud without distortion.
customer_reviews.author: orangeness

product_meta.title: JVC HARX900 High-Grade Full-Size Headphone,Black
product_meta.description: Deep bass sound reproduction with 50mm Neodymium driver unit and ring port structure
feature_bullets: Connector Type: 2.5. Wireless Communication Technology: RF
50Mm Neodymium Driver & 2 Types Of Superior Sound Structures
Ring Port Structure Provides High-Quality Dynamic Sound
Acoustic Lens Structure Produces Natural Sound Through Specially Engineered Acoustic Lenses
Pressure Dispersion Mesh Head Pad For Comfo
